description: The ITIL:Release, Control, & Validation show centers around the 7 processes within the ITIL Service Transition Publication.  ITIL RCV is based on practically apply the RCV processes that enable successful planning, testing and implementation of service management that brings business values to an organization.  The goal of the show is to provide framework for managing transitional changes, validating service management and helping organizations release & deploy the required service management lifecycle for an organization.
descriptionMD: ** Look for our partner PassionIT Group's information [HERE](https://itprotv-notes-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/ITIL_OVERVIEW.zip)  Codes for offers are available to members and in the download in the second episode** The ITIL:Release, Control, & Validation show centers around the 7 processes within the ITIL Service Transition Publication.  ITIL RCV is based on practically apply the RCV processes that enable successful planning, testing and implementation of service management that brings business values to an organization.  The goal of the show is to provide framework for managing transitional changes, validating service management and helping organizations release & deploy the required service management lifecycle for an organization. For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please [contact PassionIT Group](mailto:info@passionitgroup.com).
name: Accredited ITIL Intermediate - RCV
subtitle: Release Control and Validation

episodes.description: The ITIL:Release, Control, & Validation show centers around the 7 processes within the ITIL Service Transition Publication. ITIL RCV is based on practically apply the RCV processes that enable successful planning, testing and implementation of service management that brings business values to an organization. The goal of the show is to provide framework for managing transitional changes, validating service management and helping organizations release & deploy the required service management lifecycle for an organization.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:03.688
[SOUND].

2
00:00:03.688 --> 00:00:07.574
Hello, we're about to launch into a new
show on ITIL: Release, Control, and

3
00:00:07.574 --> 00:00:08.830
Validation.

4
00:00:08.830 --> 00:00:11.020
We wanna make sure that you have
an understanding of what's going on,

5
00:00:11.020 --> 00:00:13.990
and here to help us understand
not only some exam details but

6
00:00:13.990 --> 00:00:17.550
also what we'll be covering in this
new show is gonna be Mr. Terry Decker.

7
00:00:17.550 --> 00:00:21.617
So, Terry, tell us what we're
actually gonna be taking a look at.

8
00:00:21.617 --> 00:00:25.874
>> Well, this is an intermediate level
course, release, control, and validation.

9
00:00:25.874 --> 00:00:30.172
And if you've had foundation,
that's actually a prerequisite for

10
00:00:30.172 --> 00:00:34.393
this course, you will have taken
a survey of all the topics in ITIL at

11
00:00:34.393 --> 00:00:36.450
a very superficial level.

12
00:00:36.450 --> 00:00:39.960
And you need it to know some things and
memorize some things.

13
00:00:39.960 --> 00:00:44.930
This one's gonna dive deeper and actually
make you apply knowledge to pass the exam.

14
00:00:44.930 --> 00:00:48.010
So just take a look here at some of
the graphical treatments of this.

15
00:00:48.010 --> 00:00:51.520
First of all, the expectation of this is
that certainly you're gonna learn from

16
00:00:51.520 --> 00:00:52.700
the episodes.

17
00:00:52.700 --> 00:00:56.450
I'm going to be giving lots of real world
examples in these upcoming episodes and

18
00:00:56.450 --> 00:01:00.850
make sure you understand conceptually how
these things apply in the real world and

19
00:01:00.850 --> 00:01:03.890
how this knowledge can be
applied in an exam setting.

20
00:01:03.890 --> 00:01:06.100
But there's going to be some self-study.

21
00:01:06.100 --> 00:01:09.580
There's also a lot of value
engaging in discussion forums.

22
00:01:09.580 --> 00:01:12.783
There you can ask questions of
other experts, other students.

23
00:01:12.783 --> 00:01:16.430
And there's also some practice exams
available as downloads as well.

24
00:01:16.430 --> 00:01:22.202
That is probably the most valuable single
download in this suite of downloads.

25
00:01:22.202 --> 00:01:24.600
All right.

26
00:01:24.600 --> 00:01:29.030
The analysis that you need to provide
is not just providing knowledge.

27
00:01:29.030 --> 00:01:31.120
You're going to have to
apply this knowledge.

28
00:01:31.120 --> 00:01:34.453
It falls on this continuum of
learning called Bloom's taxonomy.

29
00:01:34.453 --> 00:01:36.750
And you'll see it's not
just remembering things.

30
00:01:36.750 --> 00:01:38.030
That's what foundation was.

31
00:01:38.030 --> 00:01:40.550
It was remembering and understanding.

32
00:01:40.550 --> 00:01:44.210
We've moved up the Bloom's taxonomy scale
a little bit to Level 3 and Level 4,

33
00:01:44.210 --> 00:01:47.920
where you analyze and
then apply this information.

34
00:01:47.920 --> 00:01:51.900
So it's gonna be a deeper dive and
actually going to be applying this

35
00:01:51.900 --> 00:01:54.890
knowledge, not just regurgitating it,
right.

36
00:01:54.890 --> 00:01:59.360
So to do that, you're gonna be listening
to me, take part in the discussions, and

37
00:01:59.360 --> 00:02:01.830
absolutely critical that you
look at the exercises and

38
00:02:01.830 --> 00:02:04.070
follow through with the practice exams.

39
00:02:04.070 --> 00:02:06.600
All of these are available for
downloads, okay?

40
00:02:07.770 --> 00:02:10.845
So how does this fit into
the qualification scheme of ITIL?

41
00:02:10.845 --> 00:02:13.160
Well, first of all,
I'm an accredited trainer.

42
00:02:13.160 --> 00:02:15.911
I had to go through and
pass muster as an ITL Expert.

43
00:02:15.911 --> 00:02:17.610
That's an official title.

44
00:02:17.610 --> 00:02:21.750
And that was given to my by following
through with appropriate training and

45
00:02:21.750 --> 00:02:24.830
exams through an accredited
training organization.

46
00:02:24.830 --> 00:02:29.570
I'm representing PassionIT Group as an
ATO, an authorized training organization.

47
00:02:29.570 --> 00:02:33.715
And here working with the affiliate
ITProTV to deliver this training in

48
00:02:33.715 --> 00:02:35.660
an accredited fashion, right?

49
00:02:35.660 --> 00:02:38.277
The exam institutes, PeopleCert, EXIN,

50
00:02:38.277 --> 00:02:43.600
they are actually the organizations that
accredit these training schemes, right?

51
00:02:43.600 --> 00:02:47.190
So the course materials I'm presenting
to you in lecture have been

52
00:02:47.190 --> 00:02:50.070
reviewed by the accrediting agency,
they've been blessed by the accrediting

53
00:02:50.070 --> 00:02:54.630
agency as being valid, and map to
the official syllabus as owned by AXELOS,

54
00:02:54.630 --> 00:02:57.350
you'll see there at
the bottom of the pyramid.

55
00:02:57.350 --> 00:03:02.237
So AXELOS is the parent and AXELOS is
the one that enable these other parts

56
00:03:02.237 --> 00:03:05.290
of the accreditation scheme to work, okay.

57
00:03:07.010 --> 00:03:10.380
This is the exam scheme, these
are the various exams you could be taking.

58
00:03:10.380 --> 00:03:13.490
If you look in the green area there,
you'll see lifecycle stages.

59
00:03:13.490 --> 00:03:15.040
They're abbreviated, service strategy,

60
00:03:15.040 --> 00:03:19.830
service design, transition, operations,
and continual service improvement.

61
00:03:19.830 --> 00:03:23.170
Over here on the right, you'll see OSA,

62
00:03:23.170 --> 00:03:28.270
PPO, RCV, that's this course,
Release Control and Validation.

63
00:03:28.270 --> 00:03:29.770
They give you a few more credits.

64
00:03:29.770 --> 00:03:34.251
What RCV does is it takes from
multiple books on the left and

65
00:03:34.251 --> 00:03:38.929
creates a course that's
operationally relevant, right.

66
00:03:38.929 --> 00:03:43.130
So Release, Control, and Validation is
this collection of topics that point to

67
00:03:43.130 --> 00:03:47.211
the value of delivering high quality
services through appropriate Release,

68
00:03:47.211 --> 00:03:49.470
Control, and Validation processes.

69
00:03:49.470 --> 00:03:53.310
We're gonna be looking at those seven
processes in the upcoming episodes, right.

70
00:03:53.310 --> 00:03:55.570
Another certification
path you could be on,

71
00:03:55.570 --> 00:03:59.180
is toward expert,
where you collect these credits, right?

72
00:03:59.180 --> 00:04:04.150
So if you get two credits for foundation,
you can get three credits for

73
00:04:04.150 --> 00:04:05.210
practitioner.

74
00:04:05.210 --> 00:04:07.760
Three credits for
the ones there in the green,

75
00:04:07.760 --> 00:04:09.440
which are called the lifecycle modules.

76
00:04:09.440 --> 00:04:11.560
The capability modules
gives you four credits.

77
00:04:11.560 --> 00:04:15.230
So passing this exam is going to give you
four credits toward the accreditation

78
00:04:15.230 --> 00:04:17.780
as an ITIL expert.

79
00:04:17.780 --> 00:04:20.325
Once you have 17 credits in your pocket,

80
00:04:20.325 --> 00:04:24.160
you're eligible to take the course
called Managing Across the Lifecycle.

81
00:04:24.160 --> 00:04:28.255
You see it there in green,
near the top of this house.

82
00:04:28.255 --> 00:04:29.701
That gives you five credits.

83
00:04:29.701 --> 00:04:35.575
17 plus the 5 give you the 22 credits
you need to be deemed an ITIL expert.

84
00:04:35.575 --> 00:04:40.045
If you're so inclined, you could also
consider an ITIL Master certification.

85
00:04:40.045 --> 00:04:45.615
This one is very hard to get
in that you have to write and

86
00:04:45.615 --> 00:04:50.875
have basically a thesis, have a good
command of all the principles of ITIL and

87
00:04:50.875 --> 00:04:54.550
show that you have that
command in your paper, right?

88
00:04:54.550 --> 00:04:56.110
A lot of pretty pictures,
lot of pretty graphs.

89
00:04:56.110 --> 00:04:58.370
You send that good 20 page paper or

90
00:04:58.370 --> 00:05:03.420
so off to the accrediting agencies
along with a check for $5,000.

91
00:05:03.420 --> 00:05:07.780
And then you can have people snatch
the pebble from your hand and

92
00:05:07.780 --> 00:05:09.687
be called an ITIL master, okay.

93
00:05:09.687 --> 00:05:13.180
So that's the exam scheme of things.

94
00:05:13.180 --> 00:05:16.887
Again, you're just one going into
the intermediates here with RVC.

95
00:05:16.887 --> 00:05:18.720
You'll see the other ones.

96
00:05:18.720 --> 00:05:21.069
In upcoming episodes here at ITProTV,

97
00:05:21.069 --> 00:05:24.779
we'll be tackling some of these
other topics as well, okay.

98
00:05:24.779 --> 00:05:29.595
So moving forward then is again this
recognition that you need to be

99
00:05:29.595 --> 00:05:32.868
providing some solid information, right.

100
00:05:32.868 --> 00:05:35.860
We're looking here at
the lifecycle modules.

101
00:05:35.860 --> 00:05:38.653
We're in capabilities in RCV.

102
00:05:38.653 --> 00:05:43.855
The exam itself is only eight questions,
so the margin of error is kind of small.

103
00:05:43.855 --> 00:05:46.215
And you'll see that there's
also gradient scoring.

104
00:05:46.215 --> 00:05:50.395
What that means is that for these eight
questions on the exam, you're going to be

105
00:05:50.395 --> 00:05:55.983
analyzing a scenario and then answering a
question based on that specific scenario.

106
00:05:55.983 --> 00:06:00.031
If you pick the best answer out of
the four choices, you'll get a 5.

107
00:06:00.031 --> 00:06:04.563
If you pick the next best answer,
you'll get 3, a 1, and a 0, etc.

108
00:06:04.563 --> 00:06:09.243
So if you do the math here, you gotta do
eight questions, the max you can get on

109
00:06:09.243 --> 00:06:14.511
each question is 5, so the total you
could score of 100% is getting 40, right?

110
00:06:14.511 --> 00:06:16.330
Your score would be 40.

111
00:06:16.330 --> 00:06:21.330
Passing is 28,
70% of all available marks, right?

112
00:06:21.330 --> 00:06:26.092
If you do the math on that,
across eight questions, that means if

113
00:06:26.092 --> 00:06:31.030
you got six three point answers for
18 plus two 5 point answers for

114
00:06:31.030 --> 00:06:35.034
10, that would be the sweet
spot of 28 out of 40.

115
00:06:35.034 --> 00:06:38.925
Of course, as you do the math on that,
picking a zero answer, of course is going

116
00:06:38.925 --> 00:06:43.180
to mean you're going to have to find some
more five answers later on, on the exam.

117
00:06:43.180 --> 00:06:45.370
So they are challenging.

118
00:06:45.370 --> 00:06:46.570
They are fair.

119
00:06:46.570 --> 00:06:50.040
But they certainly are challenging
as they try to test your ability

120
00:06:50.040 --> 00:06:51.970
not just to regurgitate knowledge, but

121
00:06:51.970 --> 00:06:56.910
to apply knowledge,
which is an interesting trick on an exam.

122
00:06:56.910 --> 00:06:59.122
Again, very challenging, also very fair.

123
00:06:59.122 --> 00:07:03.990
And the good news is, you have some
resources at your fingertips, right?

124
00:07:03.990 --> 00:07:07.720
These resources include practice exams
themselves, and you can download these.

125
00:07:07.720 --> 00:07:11.890
There's a case study, there are exercises
associated with that case study.

126
00:07:11.890 --> 00:07:14.910
And there's also a glossary available for
download.

127
00:07:14.910 --> 00:07:20.050
This download is available to you within
the episodes themselves to subscribers.

128
00:07:20.050 --> 00:07:23.150
And you can download those that
are available throughout the entire

129
00:07:23.150 --> 00:07:24.320
show, right?

130
00:07:24.320 --> 00:07:26.790
I highly encourage you to
rely on those resources and

131
00:07:26.790 --> 00:07:30.910
use them as self study tools
as you're taking the episodes.

132
00:07:30.910 --> 00:07:35.380
A great approach would be, watch an
episode, do some review, watch an episode,

133
00:07:35.380 --> 00:07:36.590
do some review.

134
00:07:36.590 --> 00:07:39.840
The discussion forums are also
a valuable place to turn to.

135
00:07:39.840 --> 00:07:43.830
ITProTV provides a discussion forum,
you can engage with other students,

136
00:07:43.830 --> 00:07:45.360
you can also engage with experts.

137
00:07:45.360 --> 00:07:47.750
I'll be there to answer some questions,

138
00:07:47.750 --> 00:07:51.480
other experts in the field will be
there to answer your questions.

139
00:07:51.480 --> 00:07:54.480
A very great way to learn and

140
00:07:54.480 --> 00:07:58.610
get over on this challenge of
mastering the topics of RCV.

141
00:07:58.610 --> 00:08:02.670
The exam itself is available
through an online format.

142
00:08:02.670 --> 00:08:04.189
You can take it in
the comfort of your home.

143
00:08:04.189 --> 00:08:07.560
You don't have to go to
a Sylvan Prometric site for instance.

144
00:08:07.560 --> 00:08:12.110
You don't have to take
the course in a classroom and

145
00:08:12.110 --> 00:08:15.130
have a live instructor
there proctoring your exam.

146
00:08:15.130 --> 00:08:17.170
You can take the exam online.

147
00:08:17.170 --> 00:08:21.760
As long as you have sufficient bandwidth
through your network and have a camera

148
00:08:21.760 --> 00:08:26.700
on your laptop so they can see that you're
not cheating, you show them your desk

149
00:08:26.700 --> 00:08:29.530
with your camera and everything so
you don't have any materials on your desk,

150
00:08:29.530 --> 00:08:34.180
you can do the course online at your
convenience at a time of your choosing.

151
00:08:34.180 --> 00:08:35.760
Right, so that's pretty cool.

152
00:08:35.760 --> 00:08:38.680
The exam vouchers themselves
are available through PassionIT Group,

153
00:08:38.680 --> 00:08:41.020
the organization I'm representing today.

154
00:08:41.020 --> 00:08:43.890
The PassionIT Group, the instructions for

155
00:08:43.890 --> 00:08:47.410
that are available in the download for how
you can get your voucher and redeem that.

156
00:08:47.410 --> 00:08:50.400
And actually, through ITProTV,
they're offering a discount for

157
00:08:50.400 --> 00:08:52.758
those vouchers,
which is also very powerful, okay.

158
00:08:52.758 --> 00:08:57.990
Those practice exams, I can't
reinforce just how valuable those are.

159
00:08:57.990 --> 00:09:01.700
Of all the downloads, and they're all
valuable, of all of those downloads,

160
00:09:01.700 --> 00:09:04.710
the practice exams themselves
are very valuable.

161
00:09:04.710 --> 00:09:08.880
They give you an idea to get
inside the head of the test maker

162
00:09:08.880 --> 00:09:11.860
while also practicing your skills and
applying this knowledge.

163
00:09:13.570 --> 00:09:16.680
That's what you'd expect
to find in terms of exams.

164
00:09:16.680 --> 00:09:20.889
Over the course of all the episodes within
this series, you're going to dive deep

165
00:09:20.889 --> 00:09:23.757
into many processes related
to [INAUDIBLE] validation.

166
00:09:23.757 --> 00:09:27.958
I look forward to seeing
you in those episodes.

167
00:09:27.958 --> 00:09:30.229
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry begin with a review of the ITIL foundations.  They focus in on the basic service model and vocabulary that a viewer is expected to understand and know.  They compare services to solutions and give different examples.  These foundational concepts of ITIL are built around customer needs.  This is important for those desiring to move deeper into the Release, Control and Validation.
episodes.title: Review and Orientation

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry continue with the some the foundational vocabulary and concept to prepare for the Release, Control and Validation. They focus in on RACI, function and service.  The guys describe the use of the RACI matrix and its importance.  They also distinguish processes and services and put into the context of responsibility
episodes.title: Review and Orientation Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the ITIL Service Transition model.  They present a high level overview of service transition.  They guys briefly describe the scope and they discuss the business value of Service Transition.  Also presented by them is the service transition strategy as the guiding factor to this area of study.
episodes.title: Service Transition Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the concept of change management.  They emphasize the importance of change management for the company.  This includes not only the culture of the process but the buy in as well as stated by Terry.  The team describes the inputs, principles and values that change management brings to the company and we begin.  They also discuss the process of change requests and the use of a system to manage these changes.  Terry makes sure to emphasize that ITIL is not proscriptive in managing changes but provides a conceptual framework for what needs to be included in it.
episodes.title: Change Management

episodes.description: {description}In this episode, Ronnie and Terry take a look at the execution of change management.  They discuss brief, as a review of the accountability of change management and the authority of change management as well.  Part of execution is to understand the types of changes and how to remediate changes too, according to the team.  Some aspects of execution involve planning and scheduling as well reviewing the changes to set the priority and urgency of the change.
episodes.title: Change Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry describe how to measure successful change management using SMART goals, Critical Success Factors, and Key Performance Indicators.  They also describe some of the challenges and risk to change management.  The team brief discusses that the improvement to service delivery involves organizational changes.  Lastly, a brief overview of the primary stakeholders to change management are defined by Terry.
episodes.title: Change Management Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the process of service asset & configuration management.  They begin by emphasizing the purpose of SACM and what some of the objectives to implementing a SACM system.  Terry also helps us to understand where to get started and that it’s first steps begin with policies that help to enforce the process.   The team also helps to define some of the configuration items that ITIL defines so that we’re ready for the exam too!
episodes.title: Service Asset and Configuration Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry continue with some of the broad concepts of SACM.  They discuss the need to using a Configuration Management System with assets and configuration items as our main interface with the data from multiple systems holding asset and configuration information.  Along with this, they also take a look at the use of software and controlling software through the DML, the definitive media library.  These are foundational items needed for activities normally performed during the SACM process!
episodes.title: Service Asset and Configuration Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry continue with a part 3 of understanding SACM.  They take a look at the concept of release, the accountability of execution.  This is important concept to know not only who but the scope of the change according to the team.  Terry also helps us to take at controls that need to be in place for the release to happen.  Part of the best practices with SACM is also accounting and reporting along with verification and auditing, says Terry.   They end with a brief overall review of the major concepts of SACM.
episodes.title: Service Asset and Configuration Management Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the process called service validation & testing.  They a look at the purpose of service validation and testing as a way of instilling confidence in the provider’s service.  The goal is to provide the better service to the customer by using testing models to eliminate pain points of service, according to the team.  Terry also emphasizes the key drivers to this process is the establishment and enforcement of good policies.  They also briefly introduce testing models and understanding the perspective of service customer.  They end with a brief look at continual service improvement as well.
episodes.title: Service Validation and Testing

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry take a look at the activities involved with service validation & testing.  The team points out how validation and testing is adding controls that will be helpful in management, function and business value to the service provided.  SV&T helps in management by providing the steps needed to insure that we provide proper testing, according to the guys.  They emphasize that the result is a better product that functions well at the level we indicated and of course makes the product a valuable tool for the provider and a valued service for the customer.
episodes.title: Service Validation and Testing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry discuss the important process of Release & Deployment Management.  This goes beyond authorization into managing the execution of solutions, changes and elements we introduce into our IT environment, according to Terry.  They describe the nature, scope of the process as well as it’s business value to the customer and provider.  Terry also briefly describes the importance of policies to help with the process management.  They also define some terminology that is common in the realm of deployment management.
episodes.title: Release and Deployment Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry discuss the four main phases of release & deployment management: Release and Deployment planning; Release build and test;Deployment, and Review and close.  These phases help us to understand this deployment management process easier and help us to not look at the what may seem to be overwhelming in scope!
episodes.title: Release and Deployment Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry summarize and review the concepts of release and deployment management.  They remind us of the key concepts, roles and responsibilities, risks and challenges associated with implementing release and deployment management.  This process also integrates in with Change Management, SACM and even Service Validation & Testing processes to provide service transition.
episodes.title: Release and Deployment Management Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry take us through the concepts of request fulfillment.  They emphasize the goal request fulfillment is not so much about incident management as it is about fulfilling planned expectations.  They also discuss request fulfillment in terms of using a self-fulfillment portal or a service desk.  The key is not so much about the system that is in place but the formalization,adoption, and use of the system that is implemented along the way.  Also the team discusses the basic challenges and risks associated with request fulfillment process.
episodes.title: Request Fulfillment

episodes.description: {Description}In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce a subset process of change management: change evaluation.  They describe the need for change evaluation is normally on a larger scope in terms of business strategy rather than on a technical implementation level.  These types of evaluations can effect the business outcome, the service operation and even the infrastructure of the organization, according to the guys.  Terry also describes some of key terminology, activities and factors (STORMPUP) that must be considered in the change evaluation.  Lastly, they summary the entire process with reminder to try and apply the knowledge learned!
episodes.title: Change Evaluation

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie & Terry take a look into the knowledge management for service management.  The entire goal is have the knowledge ready for how needs it at the right time, according to the team.  They review the constant idea of the need and the scope.  With the nature of the “ocean” of information there of course needs one some type of system (SKMS) to help with the management, distribution and use of the data available, according to the guys.  They also emphasize there is no one system to do it all but it will require integration of multiple systems that may have data; it may require a custom system; it may require just record keeping that is indexed to allow for the discovery of that information.  This is not a topic to be overlooked, according to the guys.
episodes.title: Knowledge Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie & Terry take us back to the big picture of Service Management.  They explain the importance of keeping the big picture and not just the individual processes.  They remind us that each process is part of the whole and should be seen that way to help with a successful implementation of ITIL into our organization
episodes.title: Technology and Implementation

episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over four sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Release Control and Validation section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry and Zach cover the first four questions.
episodes.title: Sample Paper Review

episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over 4 sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Release Control and Validation section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry & Zach cover questions 5 through 8, and offer a direction to PassionITGroup.Com & Deckerheads@yahoo.com.
episodes.title: Sample Paper Review Part 2
